intro: Danaea paleacea, commonly known as the pink lady's slipper, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy pink or purple flowers that resemble slippers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Danaea paleacea is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer.
